title.native: 陰の実力者になりたくて！ 2nd season
title.romaji: Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute! 2nd season

description:
The second season of Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute!

Everything has been going according to plan, but the hour of awakening draws near. Cid Kagenou and Shadow Garden investigate the Lawless City, a cesspool where the red moon hangs low in the sky and three powerful monarchs rule the streets. The true draw for Cid, however, is one who can draw blood–the Blood Queen, a vampire who has slumbered in her coffin for eons. Her awakening approaches, and Cid could finally face a day of reckoning.

(Source: HIDIVE, edited)

Note: A world premiere screening of Episode 1 was shown in the The Eminence in Shadow 2nd Season panel at Anime Expo on July 1, 2023.
synonyms: To Be a Power in the Shadows! 2
ชีวิตไม่ต้องเด่น ขอแค่เป็นเทพในเงา 2

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.
Hiroshi Nakamura is an animation producer and production manager.

__[Website](http://www.oxt-music.com/)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ Rock (Digital Rock), J-POP, Anison

__Introduction:__
OxT is a Japanese duo consisting of Masayoshi Ooishi and Tomohiro Oshima (better known as Tom-H@ck), who are under record labels Pony Canyon and KADOKAWA, affiliated with FMF Corporation. They originally collaborated under the name Tom-H@ck ft. Masayoshi Ooishi, but was later changed in 2015 to OxT when they went from a collaboration to a unit.

__Biography:__
The duo first came to life when Masayoshi was selected during an audition for the anime "Ace of Diamond", where Tom-H@ck was in-charge of the opening theme song. In a recording session, they eventually landed on a song titled "GO EXCEED!!", which Masayoshi performed and Tomohiro produced.

After this appearance, they would go on for about a year and a half under the name "Tom-H@ck. featuring Masayoshi Ooishi", before Tomohiro fronted to Masayoshi about how the collaboration didn't feel quite right with him only credited as a featuring artist. As a continuation of this, and during their rise of popularity, Tomohiro made a suggestion to Masayoshi asking if they should start a unit, which Masayoshi responded that he always intended to do so. The unit was officially announced under the name OxT on January 18, 2015.

__Members:__
- [Masayoshi Ooishi](https://anilist.co/staff/123728) (大石昌良, オーイシマサヨシ) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [Tomohiro Oshima](https://anilist.co/staff/107596) (大嶋文博, Tom-H@ck) – vocalist, in-charge of composition and arrangement

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/OxT), edited)

__[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/hotaru) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hotar_)__ __hotaru__ is a Japanese lyricist and story planner for the band MYTH & ROID. He is affiliated with TaWaRa Inc.

[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%83%86%e3%82%b9%e3%83%88) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoshima_th) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tom_oshima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom-H@ck) Introduction Tomohiro Oshima, better known by stage name Tom-H@ck, is a Japanese guitarist, producer, composer and arranger. He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. Biography His musical interest started when he was 9-years-old, as its when he got to experience playing a musical instrument for the first time in his life. Later at the age of 15, he gained more experience, but this time he got to play a guitar instead, and at the same time he also started to compose music. He started to work as a composer, an arranger and a guitarist for the company Far East Peach, where he worked as a sound creator. As of 2016 he has mainly been active in the joint unit with artist Ooishi Masayoshi, titled OxT (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), and in the band MYTH & ROID. He's also representative director for TaWaRa Co, LTD, which he established with his own production team from F.M.F Co, LTD. Affiliations - TaWaRa Co, LTD. (2016-) - OxT (2015-) - MYTH & ROID (2015-) - Flyingpan Records (2012-) - F.M.F Corporation (Source: Wikipedia)

[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%83%86%e3%82%b9%e3%83%88) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoshima_th) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tom_oshima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom-H@ck) Introduction Tomohiro Oshima, better known by stage name Tom-H@ck, is a Japanese guitarist, producer, composer and arranger. He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. Biography His musical interest started when he was 9-years-old, as its when he got to experience playing a musical instrument for the first time in his life. Later at the age of 15, he gained more experience, but this time he got to play a guitar instead, and at the same time he also started to compose music. He started to work as a composer, an arranger and a guitarist for the company Far East Peach, where he worked as a sound creator. As of 2016 he has mainly been active in the joint unit with artist Ooishi Masayoshi, titled OxT (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), and in the band MYTH & ROID. He's also representative director for TaWaRa Co, LTD, which he established with his own production team from F.M.F Co, LTD. Affiliations - TaWaRa Co, LTD. (2016-) - OxT (2015-) - MYTH & ROID (2015-) - Flyingpan Records (2012-) - F.M.F Corporation (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Profile (Atomic Monkey)](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/archives/talent/maekawaryoko)__ | __[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/ryoko-maekawa/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryokonekousagi)__


__Ryouko Maekawa__ is a Japanese voice actress. She is the daughter of the scriptwriter [Atsushi Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102503).

__Non-anime roles:__
-Collei - Genshin Impact

__Agency:__ Racoon Dog

[Agency Profile](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r11-hasegawa.html)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Rosanna - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Archetype: Earth - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
- Bridget - Punishing Gray Ravens (VG)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Website](http://uchidamaaya.jp/) | [Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=26) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/maaya_taso) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uchidamaayataso/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJFEXIRB6DP_2FQJzv7pbXg)

Maaya Uchida is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer who works for I'm Enterprise. She is [Yuuma Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/119617/)'s older sister.

**Awards:**
- She won the Best New Actress Award at the 8th Seiyuu Awards, for her role as [Hajime Ichinose](https://anilist.co/character/85153/).

**Non anime roles:**
- [Fischl](https://anilist.co/character/209685/Fischl) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Ichihime](https://anilist.co/character/200348/Ichihime) - Mahjong Soul (VG)
- Pure Vanilla Cookie - Cookie Run: Kingdom (VG)
- Admi - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Epinel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ms. NewBabel - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Gretel - SINoAlice (VG)
- Sakura - Shinobi Nightmare (VG)
- Kanami - Strinova (VG)
- S-Sha - Megadimension Neptunia VII (VG)
- Zero - Drakengard 3 (VG)
- Hiroyo Hakase - Hikōnin Sentai Akibaranger (Super Sentai)
